授業目的: The purpose of this course is for students to introduce ecological policy as a complex, interdisciplinary, scientific area of study.
到達目標:
By the end of semester, students will
-understand the basic principles of contemporary ecological policy;
-gain knowledge on complex and controversial ecological policy issues through various case studies worldwide;
-develop skills to collect and integrate different fields of study in analysis of ecology-related environmental issues.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
【合併】Ecological Policy（総合政策学部）/エコロジー政策（総合政策学部）
関連科目: International environmental policy; Global environmental policy
授業の概要・背景: This course attempts to move from confrontation to cooperative problem-solving and place the study of the environment on a sound scientific basis. The major themes that students will carefully examine include critical scientific thought, pollution, human population, sustainability, biodiversity, and the linkage of the environment to human society.
授業方法:
Face to face format

* Zoom link for permitted students　will be provided by LUNA.

第1回:
* All 14 classes will be taught face-to-face.
Course overview: What is ecology? From individuals, ecosystems, to communities; Evolution and Extinction
第2回: What is ecological policy?: Ecosystem services; Monetary and non-monetary values; Environmental ethics
第3回: Threats to Biodiversity I: Human population growth: characteristics and issues: Environmental resistance; Carrying capacity
第4回: Threats to Biodiversity II: How to measure biodiversity  *Class discussion
第5回: Water resource management: Types and sources of water pollution; hydrologic cycle, water pollution and health issues, Water Pollution Control Act, Development of sewerage system
第6回:
Air pollution and global climate change: Types and sources of air pollution
Air pollution control act; Environmental impact Assessment; Mitigation and adaptation
第7回:
Forest resource management: Social, economic, and ecological issues
Case study: Declining forestry industry in Japan
第8回:
Wildlife management policy I: Invasive species I: Ecological and social costs,
Case studies: Mongoose control in Amani.
第9回:
Wildlife management policy II: Invasive species II: Control or tourism?
Case study: Black bus fishing etc.
第10回:
Wildlife management policy III: Dilemmas: Protection or jobs?
Case studies: Marine fisheries and large mammals
第11回:
Wildlife management policy IV: Collaboration with local communities
Social issues around protection and reintroduction of rare species
Case studies: Storks etc.
第12回: Ecosystem management I: Beyond borders: Movement of wildlife; Landscape ecology
第13回: Ecosystem management II: National parks and other effective management area-based conservation measure (OECM)
